snippet: The big-spending clubs Manchester City and Paris St. Germain were fined $82 million by UEFA, European soccer’s governing body, and ordered to limit their Champions League squads to 21 players next season for breaching European financial fair-play...
abstract: Manchester City and Paris St-Germain are fined $82 million by European soccer's governing body and ordered to limit their Champions League squads to 21 players next season; penalties are for breaching European fair-play rules intended to curb huge investments by owners and lavish spending on transfers; other soccer news noted.
lead_paragraph: The big-spending clubs Manchester City and Paris St. Germain were fined $82 million by UEFA, European soccer’s governing body, and ordered to limit their Champions League squads to 21 players next season for breaching European financial fair-play rules.

headline.main: Manchester City and P.S.G. Fined Under Spending Rules
headline.print_headline: European Teams Fined Under Spending Rules
